Class EnvironmentReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • EnvironmentReader

  • public class EnvironmentReader
extends java.lang.Object
    An EnvironmentReader can read an environment for a search from a text file. It converts the environment to a char[][] so a search algorithm can be applied to it. It also detects the start point for a search that must be spefied in the input file
    Author:
    3dibbern

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnvironmentReader

        public EnvironmentReader(java.io.InputStream location,
                         int lineCount,
                         int lineLength)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an Environment reader that reads the specified file. The text file must contain exactly one 's'. This denotes the start point for a search.
        Parameters:
        location - The path of the text file to be read specified as a URI
        lineCount - The number of lines that are in the text file or that should be read
        lineLength - The length of a line (all lines need to have the same length)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the path is not valid or not a text file, an IOException is thrown
